intro: Serjania laruotteana, commonly known as the Brazilian serjania, is a flowering plant native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It belongs to the family Serjania, which includes several species of shrubs and trees. The plant is characterized by its showy, yellow-orange flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a rough texture. Serjania laruotteana is adapted to grow in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils.
